items.title: Senior Python Software Engineer Secureworks Atlanta, GA or Remote
items.content:
Senior Python Software Engineer Secureworks Atlanta, GA or Remote - Jobmote

Senior Python Software Engineer Secureworks Atlanta, GA or Remote

SecureWorks

About Secureworks Secureworks (SCWX-NASDAQ) is a global leader in intelligence-driven information security solutions. We help organizations confidently pursue business goals in a digitally-connected world. Consistently recognized by industry analysts and readers polls, we are one of the best in the world at understanding and anticipating threat behavior. We see 250 billion events every day across 4400 clients in more than 55 countries, and our solutions work across all the layers of a clients security environment, including 330 different vendor technologies. Join a talented, dedicated, and diverse team of researchers, analysts, engineers, consultants and business professionals who are focused 100% on protecting our clients from cyber threats. We seek out the brightest minds and empower our teams with the tools and support they need to fight the bad guys and maintain our companys leadership in the cyber security industry. Uniquely positioned to adapt as the industry evolves, we are also proud to be part of the Dell Technologies family. We enjoy competitive compensation and benefits packages, and reward and recognize our employees for exceptional results. A constant focus on continued learning and growth keeps our team members engaged and excited about whats next. We offer flexible work options when available, and emphasize the importance of work-life balance. We know that when our people are rewarded, recognized, and rejuvenated, we win as a team. The Team The Counter Threat Units Research Solutions Team builds and sustains platforms that our threat researchers leverage to help protect our clients against cybersecurity threats. We use agile/lean methods with an eye toward continuous improvement. We write small, well-tested branches that we review for one another and deploy frequently. We use Python to build these systems along with Elasticsearch, MySQL, AWS, and Linux. We also maintain data platforms and analysis tools that support researcher data needs for producing threat intelligence using the Hadoop eco-system tools. The Research Solutions team is a distributed team with members across the United States and UK. We use Slack, Skype, Hangouts, and email to keep in touch and Git, GitLab, Jira, and Confluence to get work done. Role Overview In this mission critical role, you will be working with a World Class Research Solutions Team to build and sustain platforms that our threat researchers leverage to help protect clients. This is a challenging and fast-paced environment, as the threat landscape and our internal customers need change in order to keep up with and stay ahead of global threat actors. The primary directive that drives everything we do is to Protect our Customers! For this team, that means making researchers successful and keeping them as efficient as possible. Your role is critical to this purpose and is the thread that brings everything our team does together into a single, unifying goal for the teams we serve. As a Research Solutions Team, we support a number of diverse platforms, both internal and cloud-based, requiring potential candidates to possess a diverse skillset of tools and technologies. Your focus will be to bring the right mix of these diverse languages, tools, platforms and data together to build the systems that the threat researchers depend on as part of their daily workflows. The role also requires a candidate that is self-motivated, results oriented and can act independently to work with relevant subject matter experts across the research team to ensure we are delivering the right solution in a timely fashion. The candidate must inherently understand the ongoing need for proactive communications with his/her team, customers and management in order to maintain the delivery cadence and quality of their development efforts. Key Responsibilities Drive solutions from requirements and specification, implementation and testing, through delivery Work with researchers to understand their needs and address a changing threat landscape Enhance system architecture to bolster existing design and allow more effective balancing of architectural concerns against future needs Document delivered solution usage and design details Collaborate with a geographically distributed team to deliver solutions based on business priorities Work with the team to improve delivery quality, increase velocity and support ongoing improvements to platform sustainment processes Act in a mentoring role to junior team members Required Skills and Experience 8+ years of professional software development experience Production Python software development experience 2+ years of Linux experience Professional experience working with relational database systems, such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, or MS-SQL Experience sustaining a production application Fluency in English, both written and spoken Excellent organization, planning and execution skills Preferred Skills and Experience Knowledge of core information security concepts (e.g. malware, IoCs, PCAPs, secure development practices) Experience with web technologies and frameworks (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Typescript, Angular.io) Experience with other languages (e.g. C++, Go, Scala) Experience working with containers (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes) Experience with "NoSQL" databases and other data store technologies (e.g. MongoDB, Elasticsearch, Redis) Experience building distributed applications Experience with cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP) Secureworks (A Dell Technologies Company) is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Secureworks are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Secureworks will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Learn more about Diversity and Inclusion at Secureworks here . LIPRIORITY

items.title: Full Stack Developer at Much Better Adventures (London, UK)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time

Job description

About us

Much Better Adventures is fast becoming the leading marketplace for one of the fastest growing sectors in travel - adventure. We're on a mission to inspire people to live a more adventure-rich life, help a global community of local and independent businesses to make a great living doing what they love, and protect the planet’s most inspiring natural landscapes in the process.

We were voted the UK’s ‘Best for Experiences’ in 2016, are continually rated 5* by our tribe of loyal customers, and are founded by the UK's 'Young Travel Entrepreneurs of the Year' 2017.

We’re backed by some of Europe’s leading investors and entrepreneurs, and are partly-community owned. Now we're building a team of super talented, passionate and ambitious people to join us.


The role

We are looking for exceptional and ambitious developers who enjoy working on all aspects of web development with a leaning towards the infrastructure and architectural aspects of the job. For the right candidate there will be opportunities to carve out a leading role in the infrastructure side of the business as the team grows. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is also self-motivated and likes the idea of working remotely.

You will be keen to learn and leverage new technologies best suited to the task at hand. Our stack is broad and wide ranging: https://stackshare.io/much-better-adventures/much-better-adventure.

You will be joining a small, cross-functional product team and be expected to dig in to all facets of the products' development.

As a full-stack developer in the Much Better Adventures product team, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in Python/Django, JavaScript/React, and PostgreSQL.



Benefits


If you want to disrupt one of the fastest growing sectors of travel, get a kick out of supporting local and independent businesses around the world, and are in your element on skis, a bike, a surfboard or something equally exciting, you are in the right place.

  • Competitive salary with share options
  • An entrepreneurial environment where great ideas are actively encouraged, and taking responsibility for them is expected
  • Flexible working arrangements - work where/when you want
  • 25 days paid holiday a year, plus 5 extra days to experience a Much Better Adventure or two each year.
  • Monthly company meet-ups in a variety of inspiring and adventurous settings
  • Budget and time for continued learning and self development, including courses, monthly audible/books budget, and access to training, classes and talks from Europe's leading entrepreneurs and mentors
  • Budget for home-working set up, your choice of laptop etc
  • Pension scheme (UK-based employees)
  • The warm fuzzy feeling that comes with knowing you are making a huge difference to small independent business, local economies and communities. Did we mention our Foundation?

Application process

We'll do short video calls to get to know each other a bit better, and in-person or longer video interviews with the top candidates after that.

About Much Better Adventures

The way we travel is changing. This is the work-hard, play-harder generation. We are time-poor, experience-hungry, and usually have a nightmare trying to organise our next trip...

So we're here to sort it out.

Much Better Adventures is fast becoming the leading marketplace for one of the fastest growing sectors in travel - adventure. We're on a mission to inspire people to live a more adventure-rich life, help a global community of local and independent businesses to make a great living doing what they love, and protect the planet’s most inspiring natural landscapes in the process.

We were voted the UK’s ‘Best for Experiences’ in 2016, are continually rated 5* by our tribe of loyal customers, and are founded by the UK's 'Young Travel Entrepreneurs of the Year' 2017.

We’re backed by some of Europe’s leading investors and entrepreneurs, and are partly-community owned. Now we're building a team of super talented, passionate and ambitious people to join us.

If you want to build a global travel-tech business in one of the fastest growing sectors of travel, get a kick out of supporting local and independent businesses around the world, and are in your element on skis, a bike, a surfboard or something equally exciting, you are in the right place.

----

You can see our current openings below.

Nothing there quite you? Fear not. We always like to hear from awesome people in the tech, marketing, sales, travel and creative worlds, so feel free to contact us anytime if your perfect role isn’t listed above just now.

No agents please (unless you’re looking for a career change) ;)

items.title: Python Developer - Web Crawling at Scrapinghub
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Big Data
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

About the Job:

Scrapinghub is looking for software engineers to join our Professional Services team to work on web crawler development with Scrapy, our flagship open source project.

Are you interested in building web crawlers harnessing the Scrapinghub platform, which powers crawls of over 3 billion pages a month?

Do you like working in a company with a strong open source foundation?

Scrapinghub helps companies, ranging from Fortune 500 enterprises to up and coming early stage startups, turn web content into useful data with a cloud-based web crawling platform, off-the-shelf datasets, and turn-key web scraping services.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop and maintain Scrapy web crawlers
  • Leverage the Scrapinghub platform and our open source projects to perform distributed information extraction, retrieval and data processing
  • Identify and resolve performance and scalability issues with distributed crawling at scale
  • Help identify, debug and fix problems with open source projects, including Scrapy

Scrapinghub’s platform and Professional Services offerings have been growing tremendously over the past couple of years but there are a lot of big projects waiting in the pipeline, and in this role you would be a key part of that process. Here’s what we’re looking for:



About you:

  • 2+ years of software development experience.
  • Solid Python knowledge.
  • Familiarity with Linux/UNIX, HTTP, HTML, Javascript and Networking.
  • Good communication in written English.
  • Availability to work full time.

Bonus points for:

  • Scrapy experience is a big plus.
  • Familiarity with techniques and tools for crawling, extracting and processing data (e.g. Scrapy, NLTK, pandas, scikit-learn, mapreduce, nosql, etc).
  • Good spoken English.

About Scrapinghub

Scrapinghub is a fast growing and diverse technology business turning web content into useful data with a cloud-based web crawling platform, off-the-shelf datasets, and turn-key web scraping services.

We’re a globally distributed team of 120 Shubbers working from over 30 countries who are passionate about scraping, web crawling, and data science.

As a new Shubber, you will:

Become part of a self-motivated, progressive, multi-cultural team.

Autonomy to make the role your own, supported by great people

Join a team with huge opportunity to make a difference

Have the freedom to work from wherever you want.

Have the opportunity to go to conferences and meet with the team from across the globe.

Get the chance to work with cutting-edge open source technologies and tools.

Benefits

Flexible working hours
Remote working
Paid time off
Paid open source work
Global team meet ups

items.title: Python Developer - Ideally with Netsuite Experience (REMOTE) at Xapo
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Banking, Bitcoin, Cryptocurrency
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Xapo is a leading bitcoin wallet, and we have a mission to bring bitcoin to the everyday lives of people across the world. We are looking for REMOTE Senior Python Developer, ideally with Netsuite experience to join us!

We need top-tier engineers with a successful track record of finding solutions for complex problems. Xapo has a unique, dynamic work environment as most of our teams work remotely, hence we need engineers who are self-sufficient, flexible and able to learn our technologies and the Xapo way of doing things with minimal supervision quickly.

The ideal candidate will be a seasoned developer with proven experience in backend development using python, with strong knowledge of MySQL programming and Redis. The successful candidate will lead the development of horizontally scalable, high-performance applications. This position is 90% backend and 10% front end. Experience with fin-tech and trading platforms development is a strong plus.

We are looking for 5+ Developers

Some perks of working with Xapo:

  • Attractive compensation – highly competitive!
  • Stock Options Grant
  • Flexible working hours
  • Remote job/working from wherever you want!
  • To join a successful startup Company growing passably

Requirements

Must Haves

- 7+ years of Python experience

- 5+ years of MySql and Redis experience

- 3-5 years experience of REST/RESTful, JSON, or Web API 

- Strong problem-solving and communication skills and enjoys a collaborative environment 

- Flexible, self-starter, fast-learner – willing and able to quickly learn new technologies and skills

Nice to Have

- Flask, docker, uwsgi and NGINX, experience.

- Cryptocurrency experience [ideally Bitcoin]

- Netsuite experience(strong nice to have)

- Solid Javascript and jquery skills

- Knowledge of HTML, CSS development

- Experience using Git, Stash, Jira

- Experience with other major development language and frameworks like C, C++, Java or.NET, Node.js is  desirable

- Experience with other front-end frameworks like Prototype, Undersore.js, etc 

- Mobile development knowledge

- Bilingual in English and Spanish

- Experience within fin-tech and knowledge of Bitcoins would be ideal

About Xapo

Xapo is a leading bitcoin wallet, and we have a mission to bring bitcoin to the everyday lives of people across the world. Our business is growing fast, and we want to make sure we can keep providing the best quality support to our customers. We’re known for our fast responses to users, positive attitude, and a real desire to find the best working solutions to the people who chose to use Xapo’s products and services.

Benefits

Attractive compensation – highly competitive!
Remote job/working from wherever you want!
Flexible working hours
Equity opportunities
Stock Options Grant

items.title: Zippity: Full-Stack Software Engineer
items.content:
Full-Stack Software Engineer

Posted May 2

Zippity
Headquarters: Boston, MA
https://zippitycars.com
View all Zippity jobs →

Hey! We’re looking for an entrepreneurial software engineer to become the 2nd engineer on our small team. We're a geographically distributed company and this is a primarily remote role but you should live in an area that enables you to gather with the whole team about once a month in the Boston, MA area.

What You Might Work On

  • The new version of our customer facing web app. Every Zippity customer begins here: creating their account, telling us about their vehicle, picking out the services they need, and scheduling a service date. We’ve come pretty far with the little app we have, but we know there’s still miles of room to improve the customer experience and optimize our booking metrics.

  • The tablet-based frontend used by our mobile service technicians. Every Zippity technician’s day is driven by an app that provides every bit of information necessary for their success, lets them communicate with customers, and ensures every service is delivered with quality and efficiency. We need your help to buff this tool so we can grow to support thousands of technicians operating in markets all across the country.

  • The next Zippity backend, including the REST APIs that power our internal and customer-facing apps as well as the deep workflow automations that enable hundreds of perfectly delivered services every day. Demand management and dynamic scheduling will become priorities in the next year as we continue to grow.

About You

  • You’ve got an entrepreneurial spirit. You’re an indie hacker or have worked in a small startup before and know the mindset it takes to make a company succeed in a fast and uncertain environment.

  • You want to work in a primarily-remote role and live in an area that enables you to visit Boston about once a month. While our mailing address is in Massachusetts, half of our team works from one of the other 49 United States. We live on Slack, Trello, and Google Drive, and it all seems to work pretty well.

  • You’re excited to work on frontend web apps made with React. Deep experience is great, but we’re also confident that smart people can learn new technologies quickly.

  • When it comes to the frontend, you feel personally invested in delivering a great UX. You should enjoy getting to put on your designer hat sometimes.

  • You’re not shy about working on our existing Python (Flask) backend. Our API surface area is relatively small, but it still needs care. Even if Flask isn’t your thing, strength in other web-app oriented backends is also great to bring onboard.

Apply for this position

Apply at https://bit.ly/zippityeng and we’ll be in touch!

items.title: Zippity | Full-Stack Engineer | Full-Time | REMOTE (US Only) | https://zippitycars.com
items.content:
Zippity | Full-Stack Engineer | Full-Time | REMOTE (US Only) | https://zippitycars.com

Our goal at Zippity is to transform the personal car ownership experience by delivering radically convenient on-demand auto maintenance, cleaning, and fueling services, all powered by a modern online platform.

We’re looking for an entrepreneurial software engineer to become the 2nd engineer in our 5-person team. Our ideal candidate is an indie hacker or has worked in a small startup before and knows the mindset it takes to make an early company succeed. When it comes to the frontend, you should feel personally invested in delivering a great UX and enjoy putting on your designer hat sometimes.

Our current stack consists of React, Flask, Google Cloud Datastore, and Google App Engine. Deep experience is great, but we’re also confident that smart people can learn new technologies quickly.

We're a geographically distributed company across the US, but you should live in an area that enables you to gather with the team about once a month in the Boston, MA area. We collaborate on Slack, Trello, Google Drive, and GitHub.

Apply at https://bit.ly/zippityeng and we’ll be in touch!

items.title: Python Developer - Remote working (UK Only) at Buto (Birmingham, UK)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time

Job description

Buto is looking to add an enthusiastic engineer to its team of experts. We run an enterprise video hosting platform on AWS which is used by many prestigious clients including England Rugby, Mitsubishi, and the Financial Conduct Authority. Our platform serves over a million API requests per day and processes millions of analytics events every month, on top of delivering terabytes of video content.


You’ll be joining the platform at an exciting time as we’re currently growing at about 50% per year and need a talented and flexible developer to help us keep pace. We’re also expanding our marketing and sales resource so in addition to this hire, further expansion of the dev team is planned for 2019.


We run an Agile ship with GitHub continuous integration and continuous deployment so we’re looking for somebody with a GitHub profile who takes pride in and really love what they do.


We love the AWS platform and use it heavily:

- EC2, RDS, Lambda, Kinesis, API Gateway, S3, CloudFront + Lambda@Edge, ElastiCache, Step Functions, X-Ray


Our technology stack consists of:

- Python (Django)

- Node.js (Express)

- PHP (Zend Framework 2)

- React & Redux

- MySQL

- Redis

- Terraform + Packer

- Slack, GitHub, CircleCI, NewRelic, KeenIO, Zendesk...


This is your chance to work on a cutting-edge, high availability, high technology platform with a small, tight-knit team of awesome engineers.

Oh, did we mention we offer remote working?

All of our dev team work from home, and come into the Birmingham office about once every two weeks.


Benefits


We offer remote working for all our development team, meeting up every couple of weeks at our office in Birmingham. Individuals are encouraged in self directed learning and personal growth and we have good career opportunities as we grow the business over the next 18 months.


Salary: 45-50K

About Buto

We help professional organisations engage, retain and build their audiences using online video. If you need to deliver internal content securely, or take real control of how your video is presented and measured on your dotcom site, we’re here to make it easy. And because Buto was created by corporate communicators, we understand the technical and strategic imperatives that drive success.

Our specialist UK team can help you seamlessly integrate Buto with your security systems, intranet or marketing automation, and we’re experts in navigating the technical – and cultural – challenges that frequently prevent an organisation from really pushing forward with video.

But Buto is more than just a platform; our friendly customer team are dedicated to ensuring that video works for you and delivers ROI.


[‘buto’ pron. ‘boo-toe’]


Our Team


  • JEREMY STINTONchief operating officerResponsible for Buto’s day-to-day operations, Jeremy is the most senior point of contact for clients, and an expert in the strategic deployment of video. If you’d like to learn more about using Buto and how we can help, he’s the man to speak to.Contact Jeremy
    (jeremy@buto.tv)
    • IRFAN YASINlead architectAn expert in developing secure, scalable systems, Irfan ensures Buto’s technology is constantly evolving. He also provides consultancy to clients on technical implementation and integration with enterprise systems.Contact Irfan
      (irfan@buto.tv)
      • ANDY MCNAMARAchief executive officerCo-founder Andy has spearheaded Buto from inception, and is a serial entrepreneur both inside and outside of the video space. Andy focuses on commercial performance, strategic marketing and partnership development.Contact Andy
        (andy@buto.tv)#


        Buto is looking to add an enthusiastic engineer to its team of experts. We run an enterprise online video platform on AWS which is used by high-profile clients including Rugby Football Union, Mitsubishi, Deloitte and the Financial Conduct Authority. Our platform serves over 5 million API requests per day and processes over 2 million analytics metrics, on top of delivering terabytes of video content.

items.content:
Fold, Keep | San Mateo, CA; Atlanta, GA | Software Engineer | ONSITE & REMOTE | Full-time | $120k-180k with equityWe are a cryptocurrency company backed by a number of well-known investors in the space.

We have opportunities across our flagship payment product, Fold (https://foldapp.com), working to implement Lightning and build a cross-currency checkout process. We’d love to hear from any Docker + Kubernetes or Django experts out there.

Keep (https://keep.network) is a new project built on Ethereum that adds a privacy layer to the public blockchain. Check out this video of our Tech Lead, Antonio, speaking at a recent blockchain event: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_uDMBzYxnqw&t=5244

Crypto, Python, Clojure, or Go experience are great, but a critical eye and willingness to master new technologies are the real requirements. We embrace remote work, and our team hails from all over.

If you are looking for the right opportunity to break into the cryptocurrency space, email work at foldapp.com.

items.title: Microsoft Data/Analytics Solution Consultant (Remote)
items.content:
Microsoft Data/Analytics Solution Consultant (Remote) - Jobmote

Microsoft Data/Analytics Solution Consultant (Remote)

BlueGranite

BlueGranite's Solution Consultant position is a mid-level role for individuals with at least three years of professional experience developing data/analytics solutions on the Microsoft platform.

BlueGranite Solution Consultants possess talent for envisioning and realizing the delivery of value through Microsoft's SQL Server, Power BI, and Azure platforms. Solution Consultants work on project teams led by Senior Consultants and Architects to design, implement, and support data and analytics solutions for our clients.

This full-time, work-from-home consultant position is for individuals who enjoy working on project teams building data and analytics solutions using the Microsoft platform.

At a minimum, we're looking for:

  • At least 3 years of hands-on, professional experience with Microsoft data/analytics platforms
  • Knowledge of data warehouse concepts and dimensional modeling techniques
  • Experience developing reports or dashboards
  • Strong aptitude with T-SQL statements and DAX functions
  • Self-starter, quick learner, with a positive, collaborative, and team-based attitude
  • Excellent communication skills, with interests in presenting and blogging
  • Degree in information technology, computer science, business, or engineering
  • Ability to travel across the U.S., with an average of 25% travel to client locations per year
  • Ability to work from home when not on-site at client locations
  • Authorization to work in the U.S., without the requirement for an employment visa

In addition, these score you extra points:

  • Microsoft or other industry certifications for BI, DW, or analytics
  • Microsoft Azure, Power BI, or big data knowledge/experience
  • Interest in advanced analytics, machine learning, and languages including R and Python
  • Demonstration of thought leadership, community volunteering, recognition or awards
  • Master's degree in technology or business

Your primary responsibilities would include:

  • Developing data and analytics solutions using Microsoft SQL, Power BI, and Azure
  • Creating informative and interactive data visualizations/models
  • Utilizing key components of SQL Server (such as SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, MDS/DQS, R Server)
  • Leveraging Azure Data Services and Power BI to deliver cloud solutions
  • Writing relational and multidimensional database queries, flows and movements
  • Obtaining and maintaining technical certifications in these core areas of expertiseBlueGranite is the driving force of data innovation for our customers. We are trusted advisors who use our aptitude and experience to deliver value to our clients. We invest in our team to become better at who we are and what we do. Our core strategy is to lead with offers for data, insights, and analytics that deliver business value on the Microsoft platform.

This position is predominantly remote, work from home, with an average of 25% overnight travel per year. BlueGranite employees are located in Michigan, Illinois, Indiana, Ohio, Colorado, Texas, Minnesota, Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina, New York, New Hampshire, Florida, or Massachusetts only.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

items.title: Python Web Developer
items.content:
Kopernio is a research tool and software platform that simplifies access to scientific journal articles, and was founded by the previous founders of Mendeley and Newsflo. Our vision is to become the backbone for scientific communication by building the infrastructure to enable a seamless flow of academic journal articles. We are making millions of scientific journal articles available with one-click, saving millions of researchers time and frustration when accessing scientific knowledge. We are proud to get our hands dirty to develop the core infrastructure that lets scientists shine.

Job description We are looking for an experienced Python web developer with full-stack experience. You will be working with a small and highly talented team grow Kopernio to support millions of researchers. You’ll be adding new features, improving the reliability and performance of the Kopernio platform, as well as integrating Kopernio’s capabilities into some of the most popular tools used by researchers today.

You will be working alongside product and UX, and directly with our founders, and you will play a central role in defining the future of our product and the technologies we use. Your primary responsibility will be the development of the core Kopernio web services supporting the operation of kopernio.com, the Kopernio browser extension and integrations of Kopernio into third-party platforms.

About you

● You have proven expertise developing, releasing and maintaining complex web applications
● Experience with Python web frameworks (Flask, Django, etc.)
● And feel comfortable writing Javascript, HTML or CSS when needed
● You have experience working with relational databases.
● You build secure web applications following modern web development practices, including container orchestration
● You should be comfortable with version control systems (git)
● You value a culture where the quality of code is as important as time-to-market
● You have a history of building and taking products to market in fast-paced environments
● You enjoy acquiring new skills and expertise as required by the project
● You have a bias for simplicity, scalability, robustness and maintainability in code and systems
● You design architectures which allow rapid iterations whilst considering future requirements and the big picture when planning and developing new applications and features
● You have great team skills, including the confidence to put your idea across, even if the idea is initially unpopular, and the humility to admit when you are wrong

Responsibilities

● Full lifecycle (ideation, building and deploying) responsibility for the Kopernio web services
● Serve as the initial point of escalation for software development issues within your area of responsibility
● Interface with product and other technical team members to finalise requirements

About us
We are a team of successful entrepreneurs and engineers, having built several companies in our field that have had a major impact on science, and with Kopernio we’re doing it again. It is a true start-up where a “can-do” attitude is valued more than any process, and where we want to push boundaries by breaking things. We put a strong emphasis on working independently and creatively, trying to find solutions to complex problems in an iterative way. You will be exposed to the world of start-ups, yet we will be clear on our purpose and objectives to advance science and help scientists to become more efficient.

As we grow, we are committed to building cohesive teams where communication, support and innovation thrives. We expect the team to actively contribute ideas and proactively take decisions in the interest of Kopernio and our users.

If you are interested in this role please email: Emma.windsor@clarivate.com

items.title: Olark: Senior Software Engineer
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer

Posted Apr 28

Olark
Headquarters: Ann Arbor, Michigan
www.olark.com
View all Olark jobs →

You probably haven’t run into a company like Olark before.

We are 40 people distributed around the globe working together to fundamentally change the way people communicate with businesses. We care deeply about customer service which is reflected in our All Hands Support model. Our passion and dedication for our over 10,000 customers is a direct result of our people centric org model.

You will play a pivotal role in our engineering culture by contributing to our positive organization and fulfilling our company goals.

Please note this is a fully remote role based anywhere in the United States or Canada.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Build and design backend applications: You will participate in the design and implementation of highly available backend applications. Your work and decisions will help support our products and give our customers the best experience possible.
  • Participate in a small team environment: You will work in collaboration on a team with members from diverse disciplines. You will help guide the development cycle using your technical understanding of the systems, participating in code reviews as a contributor as well as a reviewer. As a Senior Engineer, you will provide guidance and recommendations to teammates and product owners.
  • Customer Support: Every member of our team spends at least one day per month supporting our customers via Olark chat itself. You'll get a chance to talk directly to our customers and get first hand experience using our product!

You will help us solve key engineering challenges:

Olark is a live chat SaaS which is loaded on thousands of webpages by millions of users across the Internet every day. Our chat box must run on any website, in any modern browser, delivering messages in real time with maximal reliability. We practice continuous delivery on systems which may process thousands of requests per second or terabytes of data.

Our software infrastructure runs on a cloud environment composed of hundreds of servers in a microservice-oriented architecture. We primarily use Python, but we are not bound to any single language or technology; we use the best tools available whenever possible.

Your role will include:

  • Rapid prototyping of new features and products to drive growth and delight our customers
  • Building efficient and elegant communication channels across our infrastructure
  • Leveraging a corpus of more than a hundred million conversations to suggest actions to chat agents in real time
  • Integrating Olark with other services which will benefit our customers
  • Building systems that are secure by design, to protect the data integrity and safety of all our users
  • Modernizing existing systems, performing Python 2 to 3 migrations, and containerizing processes for execution in Kubernetes
  • Scaling our production deployment automatically to handle spikes in traffic

You:

  • Self-directed, but also open to collaboration: You are happy to work independently, but know when to ask for help. You know how to give, and receive, direct feedback. You are a team player and comfortable contributing to projects as well as open to leading projects. You deal well with ambiguity and realize it is an opportunity to experiment.
  • Excellent communicator: You are able to clearly communicate your thoughts, especially in text based communication. You know when a conversation should be in chat, or face-to-face via video call.
  • Empathetic: You realize listening is just as important as speaking your mind. You assume good faith of your teammates when there is conflict and are curious about understanding their perspectives.  
  • Comfortable or open to working remotely: Majority of your team will be distributed and you’ll communicate via remote tools: email, chat, video conferencing, etc.

Your technical background and experience:

  • Very familiar with backend development and web technologies: You have familiarity with networking, datastores, optimization and distributed systems. You’ve used command line tools to debug networking issues, know the difference between processes and threads, and understand the challenges of building software in the cloud.
  • Meticulous attention to detail: You should be able to review code written by other engineers and find room for improvement. You should have experience writing thorough unit tests that exercise your code so we can catch problems before they affect our customers. Every time we push out new code is an opportunity to delight thousands of customers (or a risk of making a bad day for those people).
  • Write quality code: You should have examples of code you have written that is easy to read, maintainable, and testable. You should be able to decompose complicated problems into elegant solutions anyone on the engineering team can understand. You are happy to receive constructive criticism on your work, and actively seek it out.
  • Always learning: You are excited to learn our tech stack, and to help lead it forward. You’re comfortable making the right call when it comes to choosing between new technologies and industry proven standards.
  • Significant production experience: You have experience shipping and maintaining production code that is used by thousands of people. You have run into the edge cases of operating at scale, and with your experience, you can help us avoid these pitfalls.

You can expect a lot from us:

First off, make sure to read about our team culture at olark.com/jobs, and our values at olark.com/values. You can also get a sense of our history at olark.com/10000. Beyond what you see there, as a member of the engineering team you can expect:

  • A great remote culture and team: Even though we’re separated our team makes the effort to connect to one another and we provide in person opportunities to meet up. We genuinely like each other.  
  • A life outside of work: Olarkers generally work 40 hour weeks. Work is a marathon, not a sprint. We are building a company for the long haul.
  • Quality-driven culture: we strive to automate testing and heavily monitor our production system. Our goal is ensuring that any end-user issues are short-lived and limited in scope.
  • We value your time to do focused work: We have one weekly required engineering meeting and a team wide sync. We appreciate and take advantage of the time we have to get in sync, but we also deeply value and respect our time to think and do focused work.

Olark is committed to diversity in its workforce. Olark is an equal employment opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants without regard to gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, race, veteran or disability status.


Apply for this position

Please apply here: https://olark.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk01me2

About this job

Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer

Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Cryptosphere Systems was founded by three Ph.D. graduates who believed it was possible to have fun, change the world, and make money. So far they seem to be right.

The work
We provide services around cryptocurrencies. We typically use Python and Django, and our services communicate with other cryptocurrency APIs and daemons on the backend. We get together for regular hackathons in different cities around Europe.

Required experience

  • Python
  • Writing and using APIs (REST)
  • Unit testing
  • JavaScript (HTML, CSS) - you'll do some frontend integration work
  • Git

Preferred experience

  • Django
  • Some exposure to cryptocurrencies
  • Frontend web development
  • ReactJS
  • Docker
  • The broader ecosystem - devops, networking, and development tools like GitLab.

Remote work

  • To be happy here, you need to thrive on working independently.
  • You need to be well organized.
  • Know how to prioritize tasks.
  • You need to be great at time management. Remote work is not for everyone!
  • Fluent spoken English is fundamental - your English needs to be good enough that our calls are not painful.
  • And, of course, you must not be afraid of the phone.
  • For legal and timezone reasons we are only interested in candidates from the EU.

About Cryptosphere Systems

Cryptosphere Systems is incorporated in Switzerland, but we work all over Europe. We are a young company that builds and operates cryptocurrency services. Cryptosphere Systems was bootstrapped by three Ph.D. graduates, and the team is growing quickly. Our philosophy is to move fast, create great products, have fun, and make money. So far we have done all of these things very successfully. We are currently expanding our product portfolio and we need more great engineers to help us do so - come and join us!

Benefits

Fully remote team
Flexible working hours
Exciting industry
Competitive salary
Hackathons
Smart colleagues
Paid vacation
10% of time dedicated to open-source work out of the company products

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: HR Services, SaaS
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Job Description:

PeopleDoc is looking for experienced and talented web developers who love working with Python, Django, JavaScript, ember.js. You will join a passionate and entrepreneurial team, and work in a very challenging environment in one of the fastest growing SaaS startup in the HR space.

Successful candidate will be able to:

  • Design and ship new features in collaboration with the Product & UX Team
  • Use your deep understanding of web technologies and APIs to advise on the system's architecture and improve our processes to get new code on production
  • Analyze, rethink and refactor the code to scale the application
  • Write unit, functional and performances tests
  • Push your code in production, optimize our deployment process
  • Contribute to our OpenSource Projects

Skills & Requirements

What you bring to the table:

  • At least 2 years of Python / Web Programming experience,
  • Extensive SQL skills,
  • A solid understanding of Linux development, you are expected to deploy your own application and features((we use Ansible to manage configuration, and you are expected to deploy your own application and features)
  • Bonus if you’ve already worked with NoSQL DBs like ElasticSearch / Redis / other,
  • GIT master,
  • DevOps culture 
  • R&D is based in Paris, French is a big plus

What we bring to the table:

  • Open to remote workers
  • A passionate and welcoming team,
  • Team work is in our core values; we learn from each other by pair programming or via extensive code reviews
  • Double screens, supercharged PCs,
  • Croissants every monday,
  • 2 annual programming events sponsored,
  • Babyfoot, tennis table and PS4 for the lunch break

About PeopleDoc

Adopted by many of the world’s top companies, PeopleDoc empowers employees to quickly and easily access relevant HR information, and enables HR to get more done with fewer resources. PeopleDoc’s cloud-based HR Service Delivery platform is the only comprehensive suite that can automate processes in all stages of the employee lifecycle, from hire to retire. Full integration with HRIS systems, combined with a SaaS delivery model, provides a seamless solution without disrupting processes or impacting IT resources. With offices in the U.S. and Europe, PeopleDoc currently serves more than 400 customers globally and was recognized in 2014 by Gartner as a Cool Vendor in Human Capital Management. The company is backed by Eurazeo and Accel Partners.

Our solutions: 

* PeopleDoc HR Document Management
* PeopleDoc Employee Portal & Case Management
* PeopleDoc HR Shared Services
* PeopleDoc Employee Onboarding

Great equipment (choice of Mac or Lenovo)
Employee Stock Option Plan
Flex Office
Allowance for Training/Seminars
Health Plan
New Office located in the heart of Paris
Generous Vacation Plan (25 vacation + 10 RTT)

Subsidized Commuting

items.title: Software Engineer- Back End at Insynq (Gig Harbor, WA)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Cloud Computing, Information Technology, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

CloudRunner/Insynq is currently seeking a Software Engineer (Back End) to contribute to the effort of building the next generation CloudRunner platform. This exciting opportunity will bring Desktop-as-a-Service with Single Sign On, together with Software-as-a-Service, further empowering our customers with the most collaborative work environment yet. You will collaborate on new feature development and initiatives focused on enhancing CloudRunner’s customer experiences. You will be responsible for software architecture, technology stack improvement, engineering processes and systems, platform and shared components. We are a small and nimble company focused on accelerating growth through transformative innovation and engineering. You will have key responsibilities and the visibility that goes with ownership of your work.

Responsibilities include:

  • Developing new features for CloudRunner/Insynq products, including:
    • Creating new user administrative tools to manage users on the platform
    • Create APIs and create rest endpoints
    • Interact with the database as well as database design and schemes
    • Gather metrics on usage regarding system login and auditing
  • Integrating APIs with existing CloudRunner technology and third party APIs.
  • Conducting code reviews to ensure code adheres to development standards.
  • Maintaining deployments in production using devops tools and methods.
  • Collaborating with colleagues in IT, Sales and other teams to collect requirements, describe features, build technical designs, and drive product strategy.
  • Collaborating with other technical leaders across the organization to develop best practices

QUALIFICATIONS

We are looking for talented individuals willing to learn and explore new technologies. To be successful in this role you will be excited to take on new challenges and adapt quickly, and instill best practices for software development and documentation.

Additional qualifications include:

  • Demonstrated skills in a high level programming languages. Experience across the entire stack from the front-end user interface (UI) to the back-end and analytics, including operations.
  • Previous experience working with back-end architecture and programming.
  • Experience developing services/APIs and consuming services/APIs. RESTful preferred
  • Experience building web applications, full-stack. Our technology stack is currently: Python, Django REST Framework, JavaScript (ES6) + React.js and PostgreSQL
  • Experience with Linux.
  • Experience with Django or similar web framework.
  • Some understanding of front-end languages and leading development efforts to enhance user experiences.
  • Experience working with modern JavaScript tooling. Including but not limited to npm, webpack and ES6 transpilers such as babel.
  • Experience with public cloud infrastructure such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud
  • Experience developing deployment tools and scripts, such as dockerfiles, CI/CD build scripts and/or other tool configurations such as chef/ansible
  • Comfortable using git for source control.
  • Familiaritiy working in an agile environment.
  • Proven analytical skills and technical problem-solving skills in the face of difficult situations.
  • Effective time management and communication skills.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, another related discipline, or equivalent work experience in the software development field will be considered.

 Our company believes in the power of diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate against any individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, national origin, genetics, age, disability status, or veteran status.

About Insynq

Insynq, LLC is an institutionally owned cloud specialist that developed Your Customized Cloud that has been in business for over 20 years. Supporting the most extensive application library on the market, and specializing in legacy applications, is our niche. With our U.S. based, 24/7 support team, we offer customized support that allows businesses to work without any restrictions.

CloudRunner is our new product that is currently being developed which simplifies enterprise security and password management technologies to enable business owners to manage their users and applications for their employees and clients with no IT or software development skills required. CloudRunner provides all this nestled in a familiar and user friendly collaborative work environment accessed with a single password. (SSO) Instantly provision applications and manage user access with a single click.

Insynq and CloudRunner are two companies owned under a group of investors (including our CEO) by our parent company, Cloud X Partners. Our teams take pride in being smaller because this enables us to accomplish more, with the freedom of working independently. We work in a relaxed environment, with food, snacks, and drinks, and go to lunches and outings frequently. We offer lots of opportunity for growth and individual recognition. We are super flexible with your schedule and allow you to come and go as you please or even work remotely. Come see why Insynq and CloudRunner is a good fit for you. 

Benefits

Paid time off
Company holiday time off
Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance
401K
Unlimited snacks and food in break room
Unlimited drinks in fridges around office (and coffee!)
Paid bridge tolls
Employee bonuses
Monthly team and company wide events
Flexible/Remote working opportunities

items.title: Software Engineer Internship
items.content:
About us
AlliedCrowds has a unique mission: to combine technology, data, and finance in order to disrupt development. We do this by creating innovative technology and new financing models that unlock capital for entrepreneurs in emerging markets, enabling them to grow their businesses, hire new employees, and contribute to the global economy.

The role
AlliedCrowds is expanding and we’re looking for a talented and hardworking Python developer to join our team. You will be working directly with the CTO and there is major room for personal growth and development. You will work in three main capacities:

Building out the functionality of our public API: We continue to add features to our public API as our client base expands. New features will include tighter integration with our data pipeline, and additional microservices to handle new client requests
Adding functionality and features to our data pipeline: Our data pipeline is the lifeblood of AlliedCrowds. Responsibilities will include developing the machine learning algorithm, improving the natural language processing engine, and building out the API to provide public access to our data.
Developing awesome products and tools for our clients: AlliedCrowds is very much a technology firm. Whether it is building the first crowdfunding platform in Ecuador, or a custom client to integrate with our API, we are always working on new and interesting projects.
About you
We expect you to be hard-working, interested in learning, and invested in personal growth. The role sits on the intersection of software developer and data scientist -- so a love of coding, software architecture, and data is a must. Your time will be split evenly between building out our API, adding to our data pipeline, and building client products. These will vary depending on priorities.

We are flexible regarding working arrangement (work from home, work varied hours, remote work), however, we do not compromise quality or effectiveness of work. Therefore, arrangements will be based on your suitability. Travel experience available for those interested.

Minimum experience:
Python libraries including pandas, scikit, numpy, nltk, matplotlib, jupyter
Demonstrated 1+ years data science (machine learning, NLP, cleaning data, data pipeline management)
1+ years of demonstrated web development (building web applications in Python)
General understanding of SQL, NOSQL, and other DBMS
Advanced knowledge of testing methodologies and an uncompromising ethic around automated testing
Ability to communicate on both technical and non-technical levels
Preferred experience:
Technical degree (Math, Computer Science, Engineering)
Previous experience at a SaaS or data science firm
Please submit an explanation of why you would be a good fit for the role and a portfolio (Github, personal website, etc.). Sponsorship opportunities available for qualified candidates. Remote working options available.

items.content:
Royal Circuits | Full-Stack Dev | Bay Area - Hollister, CA | Full-Time | ONSITE | https://www.RoyalCircuits.com

We're a printed circuit board manufacturer that specializes in quick turn prototype orders. We're one of Silicon Valley's best kept secrets – we manufacture printed circuit boards (PCB’s) for thousands of customers nation-wide, including engineers at some of the world's biggest tech companies. We’re building up a team of engineers at our internal startup, dubbed “Factory of the Future”, to completely revolutionize the electronics manufacturing industry.

We had an exciting reception to this ad last month, and are looking to bring on additional full-stack and front-end developers to round out our team to work on custom web-apps that enhance and streamline the PCB manufacturing process. You'll be involved in developing tools that get orders through production as seamlessly as possible, with the opportunity to drive interesting projects involving automation, data visualization, and machine/3rd party integration. These include developing 3rd party integrations for use with popular CAD and CAM packages, optimizing our factory processes to get real-time feedback to and from jobs on the floor, and offering real-time feedback on the manufacturability of a customer’s design the instant design files are uploaded.

Our stack is built around React, GraphQL, Python, Django, Postgres.

We're happy to offer excellent benefits and competitive salaries, flex hours, and the opportunity to work remotely. Our main office is in Hollister, CA, just south of San Jose. Love nature? We're conveniently near Pinnacles National Park, the country's newest national park.

I’m Mihir, Director of Special Projects here at Royal, and a former electrical engineer at companies like Tesla and Taser. If you’re interested in joining our team and genuinely changing the electronics manufacturing industry, send your resume to jobs@royalcircuits.com and we’ll get back to you right away!

items.title: REMOTE (Worldwide) - Open Source Developer on Open edX - Python/Django, Javascript (OpenCraft - Remote/worldwide company incorporated in Berlin)
items.content:
REMOTE (Worldwide) - Open Source Developer on Open edX - Python/Django, Javascript (OpenCraft - Remote/worldwide company incorporated in Berlin)

Development specialized on the free software project Open edX, used by many universities and companies to run online courses. See edx.org, stanford.edu or fun-mooc.fr for examples of Open edX instances. We are a team of sixteen senior developers, all working remotely from Europe, North & South America, Asia & Australia. The company is not affiliated with edX, but rather contributing and working with them on various projects. This is a full time position, were you would be able to work remotely from anywhere you want, as long as you have a good internet connection. : )

The Open edX platform is a large Python/Django codebase, with good code standards and architecture (a lot of the edX engineers come from MIT). You would work on different clients contracts using the platform. The clients list/references include Harvard, MIT, edX themselves, the French government, and various startups & universities currently running their own instances, or looking to create one. Tasks are very varied, from developing core platform features, custom exercises and tools for specific courses (XBlocks), customizing and deploying instances, working fullstack, operating our service infrastructure, improving our hosting platform, etc. You won't get bored here.

Most of your work is published as free software (Open edX is released under the AGPL license, which requires clients to release modifications under the same license), and you would also contribute to the free software project, pushing most of your developments upstream through pull requests, contributing features, documentation or help on mailing-lists.

Stack: Python/Django, Ansible, AWS/OpenStack, Debian/Ubuntu, MySQL, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, RabbitMQ, Redis, Elasticsearch, JS, HTML/CSS.

Nice to haves: Terraform, Vault, Packer, Prometheus, ELK, Docker, Android/iOS. We are building a modern infrastructure and having a strong DevOps presence on top of core software engineering skills is a big plus with us.

Interview process: a 30 minutes Hangout with a (simple) coding exercise.

To apply, fill this form: http://opencraft.com/jobs/open-source-developer/

- Experience building web applications, full-stack. Our technology stack is currently: Python, Django REST Framework, JavaScript (ES6) + React.js and PostgreSQL

- Able to integrate multiple data sources and databases into one system

- Proficient understanding of code versioning tools

items.title: Full-Stack Software Engineering Generalist @ PolicyStat
items.content:
Full-Stack Software Engineering Generalist @ PolicyStat

2018-03-28 21:59

Description

Make An Impact On Healthcare

PolicyStat’s mission is to improve healthcare delivery through better processes. We help our clients make their policies and procedures easier to find, access, and manage. Hundreds of hospitals use our SaaS application to ensure that this critical information is correct, their staff can find it, and that it supports regulatory compliance.

More than 250,000 Americans die each year as a result of medical error. Many of these deaths could have been prevented with existing best practices for quality and patient safety. A hospital’s best tool for standardizing and implementing these life-saving improvements are their written policies and procedures.

See more about PolicyStat and our Product team here

Full-Stack Software Engineering Generalist

As a critical member of our small product team, you’ll assume several roles including front-end, back-end, on-call support, API design, architecture, devops and database engineering.

This is a full-time position.

Minimum Requirements

  • Demonstrated proficiency with Python, JavaScript, Linux, Git
  • Ability to work effectively and collaborate on a small team
  • Excellent communication skills and strong teamwork ethic
  • Passion and enthusiasm for creating amazing products and delivering unparalleled user experience
  • Strongly motivated by opportunities to positively impact the direction of the company and products

Responsibilities

  • Periodically serve in the on-call rotation for triage of escalated support questions and server alerts.
  • Take initiative to address pain points that you and/or the team experience by working to improve the software, tools or processes of PolicyStat.
  • Review code contributed by the team and work with them to get it ready for production.
  • Design, develop, document, and write automated unit tests for new features
  • Proactively analyze, diagnose, and resolve software regressions.
  • Write well designed, testable, efficient code.

Highly Desired Skills

  • Demonstrated expertise with any of the following:
    • MySQL
    • React
    • GraphQL
    • LDAP & IPSec
    • SAML2
  • Demonstrated success in a fast-paced startup environment
  • A GitHub profile with lots of code and experience contributing to open source projects
  • Familiarity with AWS and/or GCP
  • Familiarity with serverless architecture

Compensation and Benefits

  • Meaningful, market-based salary starting at $80k USD annually
  • Health (including telemedicine) with HSA, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance
  • 10 paid holidays
  • PTO: 15 days first year. 20 days starting the calendar year of third anniversary

Interview Process

  • Application review
  • Complete a small timed work sample (no more than 45 minutes) in Python that consists of 3 programming challenges designed to represent what your day to day work would look like.
  • Conversation with the Product team lead
  • Complete a timed work sample project (no more than 4 hours) that is representative of the kind of projects you'll be working on.
  • Culture conversation with the team

About PolicyStat

  • Founded in 2006, acquired by iContracts in 2017
  • 99% customer retention rate
  • ~50% annual growth over the last 6 years
  • Deployed ~650 times in 2016
  • Technology stack: Python 2.7+ (help us upgrade to Python 3), Django, AWS (RDS, EC2, S3), Ubuntu Linux, MySQL, GraphQL, React (work in progress)
  • Development Toolkit: Git, Vagrant, VirtualBox, Trello, GitHub

Country

Anywhere*

Location

UTC-8 to UTC+3

items.title: Machine Learning / Python engineer
items.content:
*About NextQuestion:*
We are looking for a machine learning / python engineer to help build RNN & CNN applications to time series forecasting and demand prediction.

NextQuestion develops machine learning algorithms to reduce waste and lost sales in grocery retail. Our work has the potential to not only reduce environmental footprint but also impact millions of people shopping for groceries. We are currently working with one of the largest grocery retailers in Portugal.

Our key product is customer demand baseline pre-processing and forecasting, leading to reduction of stock-outs and expired products, delivering efficiency savings compared to traditional forecasting solutions. Beyond that we are constantly conducting research on new ways to apply machine learning to retail problems.

*What we offer:*
* Exciting and thrilling startup environment, with the opportunity to reduce waste in shops globally
* Work on state of art machine learning / deep neural network applications solving forecasting and classification problems in the retail sector
* Flexible work arrangement, accommodating academic work if required
* Remote work location or an option to work from a co-working space
* Part time fixed term contract with potential to extend or transfer into permanent
* Access to mentors and online training resources through our participation in the Data Pitch and Nvidia Inception programmes
* Competitive compensation

*What skills we are looking for:*

*Key skills:*
* You’re passionate about machine learning and programming
* You have experience building predictive/classification models, you have some knowledge of Keras and TensorFlow libraries
* You have at least 1 year Python experience and can demonstrate intermediate-advanced pandas library knowledge, familiarity with numpy
* You can efficiently apply automated testing techniques; you’re comfortable with git and docker
* You're a team player, but you can independently take charge
* You hold / are studying for MSc or PhD in Math, Statistics and/or Computer Science
* You have good communication skills and you speak fluent English

*Desirable skills:*
* You're able to implement distributed calculation solutions on cloud hosted clusters
* You know SQL
* You love creating visualisations and you would be interested to learn plot.ly

items.title: StudioH67: POC Python Developer
items.content:
POC Python Developer

Posted Mar 23

StudioH67
Headquarters: London

View all StudioH67 jobs →

Who we are!

We are a new tech venture, founded by serial entrepreneurs from the world of finance,technology and brand. Our mission is to change the way products and customerexperiences are designed. To do this, we are harnessing open data - starting with OpenBanking. We are creating a marketplace for developers, designers and entrepreneurs todeliver this next generation of digital products across sectors, not just banking.

We are on the side of the curious and problem-solving, from individual developers, toentrepreneurs, to big brands. We help inventors and idealists, dare devils and dreamerscreate incredible tech.

We are an engineering-first company, building the future of banking information exchange.Our people are diverse and based across the world, hired for their skills, not theirbackground or connections. Growing at speed in a fast-paced environment, we are lookingfor experienced POC Python Developers to join our team.

We are a developer-first company, creating the future of banking information exchange. As adeveloper with us you’ll be responsible for building our API as a product that unifiesfinancial/utility data feeds.

You will work on E2E encryption based on the signal protocol. You will be using engineeringpractices such as Test Automation, Behaviour-Driven Development (BDD), ContinuousIntegration (CI), Continuous Delivery (CD). Yup, we do DevOps and always start our workwith BDD feature files.

You will have the option of working remotely with flexible hours and will participate inmonthly team meetups at our London offices. A great way to put a face to the commits!

Here are some skills that will come in handy:

  • Experience writing REST wrappers for legacy projects (SOAP for example);
  • Good at solving problems and knowing how to document those problems in
    Behave/Celery;
  • Having an understanding of why it’s irresponsible to write an API without consuming
    it at the same time.

    With this role we are looking strictly for people who can, from 1-2 paragraphs of text, fill inthe blanks and in matter of few days deliver a technical POC. It can be dirty, it can be barely-working, but it must prove that we can deliver it, and that it will work as we need it to (alsoknown as meeting business requirements). This will be done with very little to nosupervision, but plenty of available people to talk to if you need to bounce ideas offsomeone! 

Apply for this position

If you cover at least some of the above points, we want to talk with you. And by talk we mean talk, we don’t use Codility or other nonsense tools. Instead our process is simple - let us know that you exist by sending a short email telling us about yourself and attach a résumé.Perform this short 2 to 4 hour programming task - https://github.com/StudioH67/service_registry - and when you are done please open a pull request to this repo with your solution. We get back to everyone who submits a solution to the task.After we will get in touch, and if we still like one another - welcome onboard!We offer generous salary and benefits compared to industry standards, all you have to do is show us how much you are worth!

items.title: Software Engineer
items.content:
Zero Deposit is an innovative startup looking to revolutionise the property rental sector by offering products and services that meet the needs of tenants, landlords and agents. Our first product offers tenants the opportunity to avoid paying a traditional cash deposit and instead purchase a Zero Deposit Guarantee that provides the same protection to a landlord whilst freeing up cash for the tenant to spend on other things.

We aim to grow the business on the back of continually exceeding our customer expectations. We will do that by making sure we have great people, backed up by great products and a passion for delivering amazing customer experiences.

We are looking for a Software Engineer to join our tech & product team, based in Finsbury Circus, Central London. By joining early you'll have the ability to shape your role and make a big impact on the company. You'll report directly to the CTO.

*Why you should work for us?*
* We have a strong engineering culture. We value testing, code quality and good development practices
* We believe in the products we're building. We care about building the right things for our users and building them well
* We have a support and challenge culture. We challenge ourselves to do our best work, whilst supporting each other and providing and environment where people can grow
* We have big ambitions and are well funded in order to deliver on these

**What we're looking for**
We are looking for software developers with a track record of getting things done. Experience of Python is an advantage, however we’ll consider strong candidates with experience in other languages as long they are enthusiastic about learning. We want to hear from candidates of all experience levels, as long as they are able to deep dive on technical challenges and have good communication skills.

**Our team**
Our combined product & tech team is comprised of product managers, UX designers, frontend and backend developers. You should be comfortable working in a cross-discipline team, and planning features with the rest of the business
* We have a modern approach to working and are pragmatic with our processes and the tools we use
* We are flexible with remote working, especially when people need to get their heads down on a technical tasks
* We work with pull requests and code reviews. If you are a more senior candidate part of your role will be mentoring junior team members to help them grow
* We are interested in people joining for the long run
Tech Stack
* We are open minded about new technologies and frequently evaluate our stack, without being silly and rewriting our entire code base with {{ newest_shiny_tech }} each month.

Current stack:
* Frontend: Component-based design (Yarn, Webpack, Stylelint)
* Core Platform: mithril.js, Python, Django and Celery
* Hosting: AWS + Heroku
* Some tools and services in more exotic technologies (AWS Lambda, Haskell)

**Interviewing & technical tests**
We know not everyone thrives on inverting binary trees on whiteboards. Therefore you’ll have the choice of:
# Completing a programming exercise before the interview on site
# Contributing a feature to an open source library before the interview on site
# Completing a programming test on-site (using a computer to write code in a language of your choice)

We are an equal opportunities employer and want to make the interview process as fair and inclusive as possible. If you’d like to apply or ask any questions then please contact jobs@zerodeposit.com. Salary is competitive with London based roles and is based on experience.

items.title: Senior Python Engineer - Remote in US at Knock.com (Charlotte, NC)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Computer Software, Financial Technology, Real Estate
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Our homes are our most valuable asset and also the most difficult to buy and sell. Knock is on a mission to make home buying and selling simple and certain. Started by founding team members of Trulia.com (NYSE: TRLA, acquired by Zillow for $3.5B), Knock is an online home trade-in platform that uses data science to price homes accurately, technology to sell them quickly and a dedicated team of professionals to guide you every step of the way. We share the same top-tier investors as iconic brands like Netflix, Tivo, Match, HomeAway, and Houzz.

We are seeking a passionate Senior Python Engineer to help us design and build our machine learning platform. This platform enables our teams to seamlessly build, deploy, and operate machine learning solutions at scale. You must be a developer with a keen sense of good system design and application architecture. We are looking for someone who has a background in both software engineering and machine learning.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, architect, build and maintain our deep learning machine learning platform and tools.
  • Automate end-to-end machine learning workflows: management of models, training, evaluation, deployment, and monitoring predictions.
  • Collaborate with our talented data scientists to implement deep learning models.
  • Committed to good engineering practice of testing, logging, alerting and deployment processes.

Requirements:

  • BS or MS in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or equivalent.
  • 5+ years of software development experience and comfortable learning new technologies and tools.
  • Minimum of 3 years of full lifecycle software development experience in advanced Python, including coding, testing, troubleshooting, and deployment.
  • Experience with python threading and multiprocessing.
  • Experience with TensorFlow, or similar machine learning frameworks.
  • Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and workflows.
  • Experience working in the AWS data ecosystem (S3, RDS, EMR, Lambda, Redshift, MQs, Kinesis).

Bonus points for knowledge of:

  • Optimization of machine learning algorithms for computation and memory.
  • Real estate markets and MLS (and tax) data.
  • Scikit-Learn, R, Pandas, NumPy.
  • Docker ecosystem and container orchestration systems such as ECS or Kubernetes.

What we can offer you:

  • An amazing opportunity to be an integral part of building the next multi-billion dollar consumer brand around the single largest purchase of our lives.
  • You will be working with a passionate, mission-driven team that is disrupting the status quo.
  • Competitive cash and equity compensation, full medical, dental, vision benefits, 401k, flexible work schedule, unlimited vacation (2 weeks mandatory) and sick time and are open to where you live and work.

We have offices in New York, San Francisco and Atlanta with more on the way, but we are also a distributed company with employees in 13 different states so we are open to any US location for this role.

Knock is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Individuals seeking employment at Knock are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation.

Please no recruitment firm or agency inquiries, you will not receive a reply from us.

About Knock.com

Knock is an online home selling platform that uses data science to price homes accurately, technology to sell them quickly and a dedicated team of professionals to guide you every step of the way.

We’re looking for an entrepreneurial engineers to join Knock as an early employees. Your decisions will help shape the direction of our engineering organization for years to come. We’ll give you the responsibility and the support to help make the lives of millions of home buyers and sellers better. 

Benefits

Fully distributed team, open to where you live and work.
Unlimited vacation and sick time
Competitive cash and stock compensation
Full medical, dental and vision benefits
